questions.question: What is the primary role of the KVM module in the Linux virtualization stack?
options: It provides device emulation for virtual machines
It transforms the Linux kernel into a Type-1 hypervisor
It manages virtual machine disk storage
It handles network virtualization for containers
questions.explanation: KVM (Kernel-based Virtual Machine) is a kernel module that transforms the Linux kernel into a Type-1 hypervisor by providing virtualization infrastructure and direct access to hardware virtualization extensions.

questions.question: Why would you choose KVM over container technologies like Docker for running legacy Windows applications on a Linux server?
options: KVM provides better network performance than containers
KVM uses less memory overhead compared to containers
KVM provides full OS isolation allowing different operating systems to run
KVM offers better horizontal scaling capabilities
questions.explanation: KVM provides full virtualization with complete OS isolation, allowing you to run different operating systems (like Windows) on a Linux host, while containers share the host OS kernel and cannot run different operating systems.

questions.question: In a KVM implementation, what is the relationship between KVM and QEMU?
options: QEMU replaces KVM for better performance
KVM handles device emulation while QEMU provides hardware acceleration
QEMU provides device emulation while KVM provides hardware acceleration
They are competing technologies that cannot be used together
questions.explanation: QEMU provides device emulation (virtual hardware like network cards, storage, etc.) while KVM provides hardware acceleration through CPU virtualization extensions, working together to create a complete virtualization solution.

questions.question: When would KVM be preferred over VMware vSphere in an enterprise environment?
options: When you need the most advanced management features available
When you want to avoid vendor lock-in and reduce licensing costs
When you require the highest level of technical support
When you need to run the maximum number of concurrent VMs
questions.explanation: KVM is open-source and avoids vendor lock-in while reducing licensing costs compared to proprietary solutions like VMware vSphere, making it attractive for organizations seeking cost-effective virtualization without licensing fees.

questions.question: A system administrator notices that KVM virtual machines are running slower than expected. What hardware feature should they verify is enabled and supported?
options: Intel Turbo Boost or AMD Turbo Core
Hardware virtualization extensions (Intel VT-x or AMD-V)
Intel Hyperthreading or AMD SMT
ECC memory support
questions.explanation: KVM requires hardware virtualization extensions (Intel VT-x or AMD-V) to function efficiently. Without these extensions, VMs would run in software emulation mode, resulting in significantly degraded performance.
